metadata.description: Documentation update with examples, tutorials, and comprehensive guides

variables.name: DOC_TYPE
variables.description: Type of documentation (getting-started, tutorial, reference, guide)

prd.description: Create comprehensive documentation for {{DOC_TOPIC}} including {{DOC_TYPE}}, code examples, troubleshooting guide, and FAQs. Documentation should be clear, accurate, and accessible to target audience.

userStories.title: Documentation Structure and Outline
userStories.description: Create documentation structure and detailed outline for {{DOC_TOPIC}}
acceptanceCriteria: Create documentation directory structure
Write detailed outline covering all aspects of {{DOC_TOPIC}}
Define target audience and their knowledge level
Identify prerequisites and dependencies
Plan sections: overview, setup, usage, examples, troubleshooting, FAQ
Determine appropriate documentation format (Markdown, MDX, etc.)
Create table of contents with clear hierarchy
Define code example requirements
Plan diagrams or visual aids if needed

userStories.title: Core Documentation Content
userStories.description: Write main documentation content with clear explanations and descriptions
acceptanceCriteria: Write clear introduction explaining what {{DOC_TOPIC}} is
Document key concepts and terminology
Explain architecture and design decisions
Document all features and capabilities
Write installation and setup instructions
Document configuration options
Use clear, concise language appropriate for target audience
Break complex topics into digestible sections
Add cross-references to related documentation

userStories.title: Code Examples and Tutorials
userStories.description: Create working code examples and step-by-step tutorials
acceptanceCriteria: Write 'Hello World' or quickstart example
Create examples for common use cases
Add examples for advanced features
Ensure all code examples are tested and working
Add inline comments explaining key parts
Provide complete, runnable example projects
Create step-by-step tutorial walking through typical workflow
Add 'Try it yourself' exercises or challenges
Include expected outputs and results

userStories.title: API Reference and Specifications
userStories.description: Document API reference, function signatures, and technical specifications
acceptanceCriteria: Document all public APIs, functions, and classes
Include function signatures with parameter types
Document return values and error conditions
Add usage examples for each API
Document configuration options and defaults
Add type definitions or interfaces
Create OpenAPI/Swagger docs if applicable
Document version compatibility and deprecations
Generate API docs from code if tooling available

userStories.title: Troubleshooting, FAQ, and Polish
userStories.description: Add troubleshooting guide, FAQ section, and polish documentation
acceptanceCriteria: Create troubleshooting guide for common issues
Document error messages and their solutions
Add FAQ section answering common questions
Include debugging tips and best practices
Add performance optimization tips
Document known limitations and workarounds
Proofread all documentation for clarity and accuracy
Check all links and ensure they work
Verify all code examples run correctly
Update main README with links to new documentation
Add search keywords and metadata for discoverability
